byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo, Carlotta Gall and Farah Samti from Tunis, Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Muslim extremist groups, including Islamic State, seek to claim responsibility for attack on Tunisian museum that killed at least 21 people; four of nine suspects with direct connections to attack, critical blow to tourism industry there, have been arrested.
lead_paragraph: The eagerness of the Islamic State and other jihadists to associate themselves with the attack, which killed at least 21 people, underscored the looseness of their proliferating networks.

headline.main: Militants, ISIS Included, Claim Tunisia Museum Attack
headline.print_headline: Militants, ISIS Included, Claim Attack in Tunisia

snippet: The eagerness of the Islamic State and other jihadists to associate themselves with the attack, which killed at least 21 people, underscored the looseness of their proliferating networks.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
